channel.title: Salvatore Abello's Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Salvatore Abello's Blog

item.title: fire-leak - ASIS CTF Finals 2024
item.description: This year, I played in the ASIS CTF Finals with @TheRomanXpl0it, and we secured 7th place at the end of the CTF. I decided to write this up because I’ve never seen a similar challenge before. @simonedimaria and I worked on this challenge and solved it after about 8 hours.

item.title: CVEs
item.description:
Here’s a list of my CVEs

  • [moderate] CVE-2024-25885 - xhtml2pdf
  • [high] CVE-2024-46242 - CTFd

item.title: resruby - CyberSpace CTF 2024
item.description: I partecipated to the first edition of CyberSpace CTF with @TheRomanXpl0it. It’s always nice to see some jail challenges so, I decided to write a writeup for the challenge I liked the most: resruby.

item.title: Achievements
item.description:
[TeamItaly 2023 - now]

I have been selected to be part of TeamItaly: the national cybersecurity team, where the most talented individuals will have the opportunity to represent the country in various international cybersec competitions. Here you can find our results.

[ECSC 2023 - 2024]

Every year, each country chooses 10 participants to compete in the European Cyber â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹Security Challenge (ECSC).

Other achievements

  • Snake CTF Finals 2024
  • Internet Festival CTF Finals 2023

item.title: Whoami
item.description:
Hi! I’m Salvatore Abello and I’m a computer science student and a cybersec enthusiast. I’m also a CTF player in various teams like @mhackeroni, @TRX and other smaller teams.

I’m intrested in Web Security, especially when it comes to finding and exploiting weird behavior in libraries.
I also love breaking Python Sandboxes (pyjails) ðŸ˜€

Cybersecurity is not the only thing that interests me! You can find some of my projects here.

If you want to get in touch with me, you can send an e-mail to salvatore.abello2005@gmail.com or you can use one of the platforms below.

item.title: Yet Another PyJail - PySysMagic - L3ak CTF 2024
item.description: I partecipated to the first edition of L3ak CTF with FoocHackz. I solved this challenge, it wasn’t hard but writing a working exploit took me at least one/two hours.

item.title: CVE-2024-25885
item.description: This is my first published CVE. A lot of times people write unsafe regular expressions that can lead to Denial Of Service and this is an example.

item.title: One-shot CSS Injection - newdiary - 0ctf 2023
item.description: This year, for the first time, I partecipated to 0ctf with mhackeroni. Me, @Ricy and @Alemmi solved this challenge, we spent many hours in order to find a working exploit, but it was worth it.

item.title: My First Writeup - ez-class - B01lers CTF 2023
item.description: I liked this challenge a lot so I decided to create a writeup (my first, actually) about it. Thanks to the organizers for this wonderful CTF!
